meanings.definition: A woman who has been freed from slavery
meanings.sent1: The freedwoman was overjoyed to finally experience freedom after years of servitude.
meanings.sent2: The community celebrated the freedwoman's emancipation from slavery.
meanings.sent3: The freedwoman joked that she was now the queen of her own destiny.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit soared like a freedwoman released from chains, embracing her newfound liberty.
meanings.sent5: The image of the freedwoman walking proudly as a free woman will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A woman who has been granted freedom from servitude
meanings.sent1: The freedwoman expressed her gratitude for the opportunity to live as a free woman.
meanings.sent2: In history, many freedwomen played significant roles in advocating for freedom and equality.
meanings.sent3: The freedwoman playfully declared herself the captain of her own fate.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with the light of a freedwoman who had found her path to freedom.
meanings.sent5: The freedwoman's determination shone brightly, inspiring others to seek their own liberation.
